noun.description: A thing that is composed of two or more separate elements; a mixture.
examples: the air smelled like a compound of diesel and gasoline fumes

adjective.description: Made up or consisting of two or more existing parts or elements.

examples: a dialect compounded of Spanish and Dutch

verb.description: Make (something bad) worse; intensify the negative aspects of.
examples: I compounded the problem by trying to make wrong things right

verb.description: Forbear from prosecuting (a felony) in exchange for money or other consideration.

origin: Late 17th century (referring to such an area in SE Asia): from Portuguese campon or Dutch kampoeng, from Malay kampong enclosure, hamlet; compare with kampong.
